item.dc:creator: @silabgarza silabgarza
item.description:
@silabgarza wrote:

idfk but try this haha

for (Player p : server.playerHandler.players) { if (p != null){ client person = (client) p; if(p.playerRights == 1) { outStream.createFrameVarSize(104); outStream.writeByteC(4); // command slot (does it matter which one?) outStream.writeByteA(0); // 0 or 1; 0 if command should be placed on top in context menu outStream.writeString("Mod"); outStream.endFrameVarSize(); }}}

item.title: Complex Question. lol
item.dc:creator: @Timelimit10 Timelimit10
item.description:
@Timelimit10 wrote:

Thread has been settled. Closed now. Don’t bother posting

I feel so stupid having to ask a question on here. But here goes:

Im using the right click to bigindian command features. Its all working fine. But i want a message to be different depending on the player who is being right clicked’s playerrights. Similar the the change in color depending on combat level. I am attempting to do this purely server side. any thoughts?

Dont try to tell me:

if(playerRights == 1) {
outStream.createFrameVarSize(104);
outStream.writeByteC(4); // command slot (does it matter which one?)
outStream.writeByteA(0); // 0 or 1; 0 if command should be placed on top in context menu
outStream.writeString("Mod");
outStream.endFrameVarSize();
}

Because then it takes the playerrights of the CLICKER into account. Im looking to use a variation of p.playerrights but am unsure on how to set it up seeing as i cant state p = commandsubstring.

Read full topic
